metadata.Title: CVE-2021-0342 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In tun_get_user of tun.c, there is possible memory corruption due to a useafter free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with Systemexecution privileges required. User interaction is not required forexploitation. Product: Android; Versions: Android kernel; Android ID:A-146554327.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-0342` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-45-generic - 5.4.0-45.49
linux-image-5.4.0-45-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-45.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-45-generic - 5.4.0-45.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-45-lowlatency - 5.4.0-45.49
No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic-64k - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-lowlatency - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1021-kvm - 5.4.0-1021.21
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1022-aws - 5.4.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1023-azure - 5.4.0-1023.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1022-gcp - 5.4.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1022-oracle - 5.4.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1020-oem - 5.6.0-1020.20
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1016-raspi - 5.4.0-1016.17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-45.49').
linux-hwe-5.8 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1').
linux-kvm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1021.21').
linux-aws package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1022.22').
linux-azure package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1023.23').
linux-gcp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1022.22').
linux-oracle package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1022.22').
linux-oem-5.6 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1020.20').
linux-raspi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1016.17').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-raspi').
